entry.def: Saturday is the day after Friday and before Sunday.

example.ex: She had a call from him on Saturday morning at the studio...
example.tran: 星期六早上她在录音室接到他打来的电话。

example.ex: Every Saturday dad made a beautiful pea and ham soup...
example.tran: 每个星期六爸爸都做美味的豌豆火腿汤。

means.word_mean: 1. the seventh and last day of the week; observed as the Sabbath by Jews and some Christians

Sentence.sentence: I went there last Saturday for their grand opening sale, but I drove around the parking lot for nearly an hour, looking for a space before I finally gave up and came home
She left her work early to get some bargains last Saturday
She failed to get into the supermarket last Saturday.

sentences.en: I hope to go shopping on Saturday next.
sentences.cn: 我希望在下星期六去购物。
他上星期六到国外去了。

jushi.english: The new law is applicable from next Saturday.
We can visit you on Saturday or Sunday; our plans are fairly flexible.
jushi.chinese: 我们可以星期六或星期日去拜访你,我们的计划是较灵活的。

jushi.english: The Saturday night rally in the stadium was rained out.
jushi.chinese: 星期六晚上在体育场举行的集会因下雨而取消了。
